Stories published on March 26, 2020

March 26, 2020

Faculty Senate approves academic policy changes in response to COVID-19 Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/26/faculty-senate-meets-virtually/

At a special emergency meeting on March 26, the Faculty Senate approved a variety of new academic policies, including implementing a Satisfactory/No Credit grade for spring quarter.

Stanford Engineering — March 26, 2020

The race to save the ocean Link: https://engineering.stanford.edu/magazine/article/fiorenza-micheli-race-save-ocean

Fiorenza “Fio” Micheli grew up on the Mediterranean Sea, where she fell in love with the ocean and made it the object of her scientific career.

March 26, 2020

Stanford students map free meals for Bay Area schoolchildren Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/26/stanford-students-map-free-meals-bay-area-schoolchildren/

An interdisciplinary team of Stanford students created a virtual map showing where local schoolchildren can receive free meals during school closures caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

March 26, 2020

Coordinated response needed to fight coronavirus pandemic Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/26/coordinated-response-needed-fight-coronavirus-pandemic/

Without coordination within and across countries, the novel coronavirus will endlessly reemerge, with devastating consequences for public health and the global economy, says Stanford scholar Matthew Jackson.

March 26, 2020

Understanding spread of COVID-19 Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/26/understanding-spread-covid-19/

Stanford professor Alexandria Boehm and visiting scholar Krista Wigginton describe potential transmission pathways of COVID-19 and their implications.
